page.title: 06HOUSING
page.content: The area is sparsely settled, and there are, therefore, few houses in the block. Two or three cottages and one farm in{West Torrington}possibly contain 17th century work, but have had later additions or rebuilding. Some isolated farm houses probably date from the late 18th century Enclosures, but much of the housing dates from the 19th century. This varies between large farm-houses and a vicarage to small labourers' cottages. Most of these have been enlarged, amalgamated and modernised, whether they are tied cottages or individually owned. There are a few recent bungalows in{West Torrington,}and some council housing. There are 2 council houses in{Bleasby Moor,}and one recent house at{East Torrington.}
